alert.note: Alert for Clay; Norman; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 05 at 11:41AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...NEAR BLIZZARD CONDITIONS WILL AFFECT SOUTHEAST NORTH DAKOTA AND SOUTHERN RED RIVER VALLEY... An area of snow and blowing snow will affect southeast North Dakota into the southern Red River Valley into the early afternoon. These conditions are associated with an area of snow and gusty northwest winds up to 45 mph moving across this area. Persons and vehicles across this area can expect conditions to suddenly deteriorate to extremely poor visibility under half a mile lasting one or two hours before improving. These conditions will continue through 2 PM CST into the southern Red River Valley, including the Fargo metro area. Rapid changes in visibility and difficult travel conditions may lead to accidents. If you are traveling in these conditions, reduce your speed and turn on headlights. Don`t slam on brakes or use cruise control.
